Anniversary of Independence of Benin Celebrated
articles.content:
Anniversary of Independence of Benin Celebrated 
    Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held here on Monday to celebrate the 45th anniversary of the independence of Benin.
 Present there were members of the Korea-Benin Friendship Association and working people in the city.    
 A speech was made before a congratulatory message to the Beninese president was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Reception Given on National Day of Swiss Confederation
articles.content:
Reception Given on National Day of Swiss Confederation 
    Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- Rudolf Strasser, country director of the Swiss Federal Department of Foreign Affairs to the DPRK, hosted a reception on Monday evening to mark the national day of the Swiss Confederation.
 Present on invitation were officials concerned and diplomatic envoys of different countries and representatives of international organizations here.
 Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: Reception Given to Mark Army Day of China
articles.content:
Reception Given to Mark Army Day of China 
    Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- Military Attache of the Chinese embassy here Yang Xilian gave a reception at the embassy on Monday evening to mark the 78th anniversary of the foundation of the Chinese People's Liberation Army.
 Present on invitation were Vice-Minister of the People's Armed Forces Kim Sang Ik, Colonel General of the Korean People's Army Sim Sang Dae, other generals and officers of the KPA and officials concerned and diplomats and military attaches of various foreign embassies here.    
 Chinese Ambassador to the DPRK Wu Donghe and embassy officials were on hand.
 Speeches were made at the reception.

Greetings to Macedonian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Macedonian President
    Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People�fs Assembly, today sent a message of greetings to Macedonian President Branko Crvenkovski on the occasion of its national day.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries will grow stronger in the future, the message sincerely wished the president greater success in his responsible work for prosperity of the nation and well-being of the people.

articles.title: Greetings to PM of Macedonia
articles.content:
Greetings to PM of Macedonia
    Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- Pak Pong Ju, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Vlado Buckovski, prime minister of Macedonia, on the national day of his country.
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would boost in the future, the message sincerely wished him great success in his responsible work for durable security and prosperity of the country.    
 Meanwhile, Foreign Minister Paek Nam Sun sent to his Macedonian counterpart Ilinka Mitreva a similar message wishing her success in her responsible work for Macedonia's entry into the EU.

articles.title: Vice-President of S. Korean Red Cross Here
articles.content:
Vice-President of S. Korean Red Cross Here
    Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- Ri Se Ung, vice-president of the south Korean Red Cross, and his party arrived here Tuesday.
 They were met at the airport by Choe Song Ik, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the DPRK Red Cross Society, and officials concerned.

Gift to Kim Jong Il from Mongolian Delegation
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il from Mongolian Delegation
    Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- Leader Kim Jong Il was presented with a gift by the visiting delegation of the Mongolian Mt. Paektu Association for Independent Development.
 It was conveyed to an official concerned by G. Bold, executive chairman of the Darhan Ol Provincial Branch of the association who is heading the delegation.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets Swedish Ambassador
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Swedish Ambassador
    Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with outgoing Swedish Ambassador to the DPRK Paul Beijer at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Tuesday.

articles.title: DPRK Men and Women Footballers Beat Japanese Teams
articles.content:
DPRK Men and Women Footballers Beat Japanese Teams
    Pyongyang, August 2 (KCNA) -- DPRK men and women football teams trounced their Japanese rivals for the East Asian Cup 1-0 each.
